meanings.sent1: She bowed deeply in recreances to the queen.
meanings.sent2: The soldier saluted as a sign of recreances to his commanding officer.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail in recreances to the bigger dog.
meanings.sent4: The trees swayed in recreances to the wind's power.
meanings.sent5: The students stood in recreances as the principal entered the room.

meanings.definition: A gesture or action indicating submission or surrender.
meanings.sent1: The defeated knight knelt in recreances before his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The white flag was raised as a symbol of recreances.
meanings.sent3: The cat rolled onto its back in recreances to the playful kitten.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed against the shore in recreances to the incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The criminal raised his hands in recreances to the police officers.
